page.title: 11Farming A: Landcover
page.content: The landcover around Bridgerule is mainly grassland. The soil is clay based and tends to be wet if not drained. One hundred years ago, one of the main farms of the area was composed of three farms and extended to 500 acres. It is now 240 acres in area composed of a heavy fertile soil. This required a lot of draining in the past which was done with small 2-inch pipes about three feet deep and before that stone drains were put in. In the last 15 years the whole farm has been drained up to 8ft deep to tape the rising springs. There is not much marshland in the area but a fair spread of copse and woodland making the landscape interesting and quite beautiful.
